Draw the image.

If img is not 2-dimensional, do nothing.

socket_plotter.app.lineplotter module

class socket_plotter.app.lineplotter.LinePlotter(addr: str, port: int)[source]

Bases: object

DEFAULT_SIZE = (600, 400)
DEFAULT_WINDOW_TITLE = 'Line Plotter'
clear()[source]
draw(*dat)[source]

Plot a line or lines.

The structure of dat will be automatically determined. dat should be in the following forms:

  • ydata

  • [ydata]

  • xdata, ydata

  • xdata, [ydata]

  • xdata, ydata1, ydata2, ...

If socket connection is refused, a new plotter will be launched.

Parameters

*dat – data to be plotted. See the above note.

draw_unpack(args: Sequence[Any])[source]

wrapper for signal communication.

This function receives a sequence object. The object will be unpacked and pass to draw.

Parameters

args (Sequence[Any]) – an object to be unpacked.

socket_plotter.app.receiver module

class socket_plotter.app.receiver.QThreadReceiver(addr: str, port: int, parent=None)[source]

Bases: QThread

QThread as a socket-receiver

The communication protocol is as the followings:

  1. Wait a connection

  2. Receive a header in json format like:

    {
    "size": int,
    "type": Literal['data', 'data_json', 'attr', 'ping']
}

    If type==ping, do nothing. Go to (1).

  3. Return a string, A header was received.

  4. Receive size bytes. If type==data_json, a json-formatted data is coming. Otherwise, the incoming object is deserialized by pickle.loads.

When the above protocol finishes properly, the received object will be passed to the received object to the plotter. - If type==data or data_json, using sigData. - If type==attr, using sigAttr.

When an error occurs during a protocol, sigError will be emitted.

buffer_size = 2048
